title: Teaching
text:
I delivered specialized classes and courses, mostly focused analysis of movement, behavioural and spatial data in R.
May 2023
Movement ecology: Analysis of animal movement data in R, Universidad de la República, Montevideo, Uruguay (40h)
October 2022
Analysis of GLS data, CEBC-CNRS, France (4h)
April 2020
Analysis of activity data from GLS, UB, Spain (8h)
April 2017
Introduction to R, UB, Spain (20h)
2013-2016
Teaching assistant in classes: Chordate Practices, Biodiversity practices, Laboratory practices (Biology, Biomedical Sciences), Field work Zoology and Marine Sciences. UB, Spain (total 145 h)

title: Conferences
text:
I enjoyed presenting my research at multiple national and international conferences.
Include photo from penuin conf
Talks
11th International Penguin Conference. Chile. September 2023 Zajková, Z., Ropert-Coudert, Y., Chiaradia, A., Seddon, P., Ramírez, F. “Safe Operating Space for Penguins (SOSPEN)” initiative: a global effort towards the IUCN-Penguin Specialist Group vision of “penguins in perpetuity”.
10th SCAR Open Science Conference. Online. August 2022 Zajková, Z., Kato, A., Raclot, T., Angelier, F., Marciau, C., Thiebot, J. B., Ropert-Coudert, Y. Do Adélie penguins care about boundaries? Spatio-temporal consistency in the wintering behaviour of Antarctic sentinel species – implications for conservation.
Annual meeting day of the Marine Predators Team, CEBC-CNRS. Chizé, France. May 2022 Zajková, Z., Kato, A., Raclot, T., Angelier, F., Marciau, C., Thiebot, J. B., Ropert-Coudert, Y. Do Adélie penguins care about boundaries? Spatio-temporal consistency in the wintering behaviour of Antarctic sentinel species – implications for conservation.
Measuring Behaviour 2018. Manchester, United Kingdom. June 2018 Zajková, Z., Reyes-González, J.M., González-Solís, J., Bartumeus, F. The Movement Ecology of Seabirds revealed with Unsupervised Behavioural Clustering.
I Jornada d’investigadors predoctorals (JIP-CEAB). Blanes, Spain. June 2017 Zajková, Z. Movement ecology in pelagic seabirds.
6th International Albatross and Petrels Conference. Barcelona, Spain. September 2016 Zajková, Z., Riera-Buch, M., Ryan, P.G., González-Solís, J. Giant petrels: a textbook example of sexual segregation in birds.
Aranda L., Militão, T., Zajková, Z., Reyes-González, J.M., Ryan, P.G., González-Solís, J. The trans-equatorial migration of great shearwaters. Talk (presented by LA).
Reyes-González, J.M., Zajková, Z., Ramos, R., González-Solís, J. Multi-year tracking of seabirds as a tool to develop adaptive management strategies: the case of Cory’s shearwaters foraging in the Canary Current. Talk (presented by JMRG).
BOU: Birds in time and space: avian tracking and remote sensing. Leicester, UK. March 2015 Reyes-González, J.M., Zajková, Z., Ramos, R., González-Solís, J. Annual consistency of foraging grounds depends on spatial scale and population/individual level: the case of Cory’s Shearwater in the Canary Current upwelling. Talk (presented by JMRG).
15th National and 12th International Conference of Spanish Ethological Society. Barcelona, Spain. September 2014 Zajková, Z., Guallar, S., González-Solís, J. Individual activity strategies and cycles in a small oceanic seabird.
12th International Conference of Seabird Group. Oxford, UK. March 2014 Zajková, Z., Guallar, S., Militão, T., González-Solís, J. Movements and at-sea activity of Boyd’s Shearwaters (Puffinus boydi) using geolocators and stable isotope analysis.
37th Annual meeting of the Waterbird Society. Wilhelmshaven, Germany. September 2013 Zajková, Z., Guallar, S., Militão, T., González-Solís, J. Movements and at-sea activity of Boyd’s Shearwaters (Puffinus boydi) using geolocators and stable isotope analysis.
Posters
8th International Bio-logging Conference. Japan. Online. March 2024 Zajková, Z., Ropert-Coudert, Y., Chiaradia, A., Seddon, P., Ramírez, F. “Safe Operating Space for Penguins (SOSPEN): a global bio-logging initiative for penguin conservation”.
Zaldúa, N., Zajková, Z., Farías, A., Marciau, C., Machado-Gaye, A.L., Menéndez-Blázquez, J., Muñoz, J., Raslan, M., Rozas Sia, M.G., Valdes, A., Vaz-Canosa, P., Ropert-Coudert, Y., Kato, A. & Soutullo, A. Winter migration and isotopic niche of Adélie penguins from Western Antarctic Peninsula: species ecological insights to contribute to marine spatial planning and management.
18th CNFRAA, Toulouse. France. May 2022 Zajková, Z., Kato, A., Raclot, T., Angelier, F., Marciau, C., Thiebot, J. B., Ropert-Coudert, Y. Do Adélie penguins care about boundaries? Spatio-temporal consistency in the wintering behaviour of Antarctic sentinel species – implications for conservation.
1st Meeting of the Iberian Ecological Society & XIV AEET Meeting. Barcelona, Spain. February 2019 Zajková, Z., Reyes-González, J.M., González-Solís, J., Bartumeus, F. The Movement Ecology of Seabirds revealed with Unsupervised Behavioural Clustering.
22th Conference of Spanish Ornithological Society. Madrid, Spain. December 2014 Zajková, Z., Guallar, S., González-Solís, J. New insights into behavioural strategies and time cycles in a small oceanic seabird: Boyd’s Shearwater (Puffinus boydi). Pastor-Prieto, M., Reyes González, J. M., Rivas, M., Zajková, Z., Cuthbert, R., Ryan, P. G., González-Solís, J. Revealing the annual cycle of a highly pelagic seabird from the South Atlantic: Atlantic Petrel (Pterodroma incerta).
5th International Bio-Logging Science Symposium (BLS5). Strasbourg, France. September 2014 Zajková, Z., Guallar, S., González-Solís, J. Individual activity strategies and circadian, circalunar and circannual activity in Boyd’s Shearwaters.
Attendence (no contribution)
International Seabird Group Conference, Portugal. September 2024
Congreso Nacional y Iberoamaricano de Etología y Ecología Evolutiva, Badajoz, Spain. November 2023

title: Publications
text:
My publications
Research articles peer-reviewed published/accepted
Morera‐Pujol, V., Catry, P., Magalhães, M., Péron, C., Reyes‐González, J. M., Granadeiro, J. P., ... & Ramos, R. (2025). Migratory Connectivity and Non‐Breeding Habitat Segregation Across Biogeographical Scales in Closely Related Seabird Taxa. Diversity and Distributions, 31(3), e70013.
Zaldúa, N., Zajková, Z., Machado-Gaye, A. L., Franco-Trecu, V., Cosse, M., Ropert-Coudert, Y., Kato, A. & Soutullo, A. (2024). Changing the focus: The need for cross-scale dynamic management in the Southern Ocean and implications for holistic conservation of Antarctic marine living resources. Marine Policy, 170, 106361. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.marpol.2024.106361.
Morera‐Pujol, V., Catry, P., Magalhães, M., Péron, C., Reyes‐González, J. M., Granadeiro, J. P., …, Zajková, Z., … & Ramos, R. (2023). Methods to detect spatial biases in tracking studies caused by differential representativeness of individuals, populations and time. Diversity and Distributions, 29, 19–38. https://doi. org/10.1111/ddi.13642.
Halpin, L. R., Ross, J. D., Ramos, R., …, Zajková, Z., … & Clarke, R. H. (2021). Double‐tagging scores of seabirds reveals that light‐level geolocator accuracy is limited by species idiosyncrasies and equatorial solar profiles. Methods in Ecology and Evolution, 12(11), 2243-2255. https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.13698.
Beal, M., Dias, M. P., Phillips, R. A., Oppel, S., Hazin, C., …, Zajková, Z., Zango, L., & Catry, P. (2021). Global political responsibility for the conservation of albatrosses and large petrels. Science Advances 3;7(10):eabd7225. doi: 10.1126/sciadv.abd7225.
Culina, A., Adriaensen, F., Bailey, L. D., Burgess, M. D., Charmantier, A., Cole, E. F., …, Zajková, Z., …, & Visser, M. E. (2020). Connecting the data landscape of long‐term ecological studies: the SPI‐Birds data hub. Journal of Animal Ecology, 90(9), 2147-2160. https://doi.org/10.1111/1365-2656.13388.
Ramos, R., Paiva, V. H., Zajková, Z., Precheur, C., Fagundes, A. I., Jodice, P. G. R., Mackin, W., Zino, F., Bretagnolle, V., González-Solís, J. (2020) Spatial ecology of closely-related taxa: the case of the little shearwater complex in the North Atlantic Ocean. Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society, 191(2), 482-502. https://doi.org/10.1093/zoolinnean/zlaa045.
Ramos, R., Reyes-González, J. M., Morera-Pujol, V., Zajková, Z., Militão, T., & González-Solís, J. (2020). Disentangling environmental from individual factors in isotopic ecology: A 17-year longitudinal study in a long-lived seabird exploiting the Canary Current. Ecological Indicators, 111, 105963. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecolind.2019.105963.
Pastor-Prieto, M., Ramos, R., Zajková, Z., Reyes-González, J.M., Rivas, M.L., Ryan, P.G., González-Solís, J. (2019). Spatial ecology, phenological variability and moulting patterns of the Endangered Atlantic petrel Pterodroma incerta. Endangered Species Research, 40, 189-206. doi: https://doi.org/10.3354/esr00991.
Zango, L., Reyes-González, J. M., Militão, T., Zajková, Z., Álvarez-Alonso, E., Ramos, R., & González-Solís, J. (2019). Year-round individual specialization in the feeding ecology of a long-lived seabird. Scientific reports, 9(1), 1-12. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-019-48214-0.
Zajková, Z., Militão, T., González-Solís, J. (2017). Year-round movements of a small seabird and oceanic isotopic gradient in the tropical Atlantic. Mar Ecol Prog Ser 579 169-183. https://doi.org/10.3354/meps12269.
Becker P. H., Schmaljohann H., Riechert J., Wagenknecht G., Zajková, Z., González-Solís J. (2016). Common Terns on the East Atlantic Flyway: temporal–spatial distribution during the non-breeding period. Journal of Ornithology. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10336-016-1346-2.
Rodríguez-Ruiz J., de la Puente J., Parejo D., Valera F., Calero-Torralbo M. A., Reyes-González J. M., Zajková, Z., Bermejo A., Avilés J. M. (2014). Disentangling Migratory Routes and Wintering Grounds of Iberian Near-Threatened European Rollers Coracias garrulus. PLoS ONE 9(12): e115615. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0115615.
Reports
Soutullo, A., Machado-Gaye, A. L., Zajková, Z., Kato, A., Ropert-Coudert, Y. (2022). Adélie penguins of King George Island depend on resources in CCAMLR subarea 48.1 in summer, but subareas 48.5 and 48.2 in winter. Report for the Working Group on Ecosystem Monitoring and Management (WG-EMM-2022/44) of Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources (CCAMLR).

title: Supervision
text:
PhD Students
2022 - 2025 Natalia Zaldúa, Universidad de la República, Uruguay (Co-supervision with Dr Alvaro Soutullo & Dr Valentina Franco-Trecu) Contributions to knowledge about a sentinel species of Antarctic ecosystems, the Adélie penguin
Master Students
2024 - 2025 Joana Riera Roca, UB, Spain (Co-supervision with Dr Francisco Ramírez) Mapping Habitats for Southern Hemisphere Penguins: a Penguin Conservation Initiative 2024 - 2025 Francisco Pablo Salvador, UAB, Spain (Co-supervision with Dr Francisco Ramírez & Jorge Mestre) Sensitivity of habitat suitability models to temporal and spatial filtering of tracking data 2014 - 2015 Marta Riera-Buch, UB, Spain (Co-supervision with Dr Jacob González-Solís) Spatial segregation between sexes and species of giant petrels 2013 - 2014 Laila Aranda, UB, Spain (Co-supervision with Dr Jacob González-Solís) The trans-equatorial migration of great shearwaters

title: Fieldwork
text:
I enjoy a lot doing fieldwork. So far, I have had an opportunity to participate and lead following fieldwork campaigns, mostly during my PhD studies.
August 2022 Chafarinas Islands, Spain Tracking of foraging movements of Cory’s and Scopoli’s Shearwater
June - July 2013, 2014, 2015
Gran Canaria, Canary Islands, Spain Migration and foraging ecology of Cory’s Shearwater by GLS and GPS I was a group leader in summer campaigns 2014 and 2015.
October 2013 and 2014
Breeding success of Cory’s Shearwater (chicks’ ringing, tissue sampling) Gran Canaria, Canary Islands, Spain
April 2013
Sa Dragonera, Mallorca, Spain Tracking of Balearic Shearwater by GLS and GPS devices
June 2012
Montaña Clara, Chinijo Archipelago, Canary Islands, Spain Tracking of Cory’s Shearwater and Bulwer’s Petrel by GLS devices
August 2009 - September 2010 Vallée de Baux, Provence, France Monitoring of breeding population of European Roller
